mesa 0.2.1
  • Reference

    Calculate and add CNV based on HMMcopy, on individual samples

    addHMMcopyCNV.Rd

    This calculates and adds CNV to a qseaSet based on just using HMMcopy on each sample, with default parameters. Only works for hg38/GRCh38!

    addHMMcopyCNV(
  qs,
  inputColumn = "input_file",
  windowSize = 1000000,
  fragmentLength = NULL,
  plotDir = NULL,
  parallel = TRUE,
  maxInsertSize = 1000,
  minInsertSize = 50,
  minReferenceLength = 30,
  minMapQual = 30,
  properPairsOnly = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    qs

    The qseaSet object

    inputColumn

    Which column of the sample table contains the link to the bam file

    windowSize

    What window size to use (only 50000, 500000 or 1000000 work at the moment)

    fragmentLength

    Fragment length to extend reads to if not paired

    plotDir

    A directory to export individual HMMcopy plots to.

    parallel

    Whether to use parallelisation

    maxInsertSize

    For paired reads, only keep them if they are below a maximum length. Can be used for cfDNA size selection. Applies to Input samples as well as MeCap.

    minInsertSize

    For paired reads, only keep them if they are above a minimum length. Can be used for cfDNA size selection. Applies to Input samples as well as MeCap.

    minReferenceLength

    A minimum distance on the genome to keep the read. bwa by default gives 19bp as minimum for a read, which is quite short.

    minMapQual

    Minimum mapping quality to include a read (on either end if proper pair)

    properPairsOnly

    Whether to only keep properly paired reads, or to keep high-quality (MAPQ 30+) unpaired R1s as well. Set to TRUE for size selection.

    Value

    A qseaGLM object

    Contents

    Developed by Simon Pearce, Steven Hill.
